title: Infosys employees start this fiscal with 80% bonus
description: The payout comes after Infosys led industry growth in Q1FY25 reporting healthy earnings of a 7.1% year-on-year growth in net profit on a 3.6% revenue growth as against further subdued growth by its top tier peers. The firm has also raised its revenue guidance for the full year FY25 to 3-4% in constant currency terms citing return of business demand and bullish market environment in the last two quarters.
content: IT services firm Infosys kicked off the fiscal 2024-25 performance bonus pay-outs to eligible employees at an average of 80% for the first quarter ended June, in what could potentially uplift the mood across vast sections of the technology workforce.This pay-out is a substantial jump from the previous quarter ended March 31 when India’s second largest IT services firm had paid an average 60% of the targeted bonus.“This is the best we have seen in some time,” an Infosys employee told ET on the condition of anonymity.The average percentage figure refers to the bonus paid to employees at band six (E6) and below, who form the bulk of the Bengaluru-headquartered company’s workforce.The pay-out comes after Infosys led industry growth in the first quarter of fiscal 2025 reporting 7.1% year-on-year growth in net profit and a 3.6% expansion in revenue, as against subdued performance by its top-tier peers. The firm has also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to 3-4% in constant currency terms, citing return of business demand and bullish market environment in the last two quarters.
